newsitem.title: CHINA: Johnson & Johnson opens fourth Shanghai venture.
newsitem.headline: Johnson & Johnson opens fourth Shanghai venture.

text.p: Johnson & Johnson on Wednesday opened its fourth venture in Shanghai, involving investment of $30 million, to produce and distribute the drug Tylenol, the company said in a statement.
Shanghai Johnson & Johnson Pharmaceuticals Ltd is a joint venture between Johnson & Johnson and Shanghai Number One Bio-chemicals Company in the Minhang development zone, it said.

The estimated annual output capacity of the plant will be 830 million tablets and 53 million bottles of liquid medicine for sale in China, with an estimated annual production value of 1.5 billion yuan, it said.
The joint venture has implemented advanced computerised ingredients-mixing facilities and automatic tablet and liquid medicine packaging line, it said.
Tylenol, Johnson & Johnson's major brand, has been the leading self-medication brand in the U.S. since 1979, it said.
The investment takes the company's total investment in Shanghai to about $175 million, it said.

Larry Pickering, company group chairman of Johnson & Johnson Consumer Pharmaceuticals, said at the opening ceremony that the company planned to open a fifth plant in Shanghai shortly. He gave no details.
